rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:1
rsbNotes.text: 27:1 light. God brings clarity, order, and understanding, while darkness is evil and chaotic. See Nah. 1:8, where the defeat of the enemy is shown by their being pursued into darkness. Also see “God Is Light: Divine Holiness and Justice” at Lev. 11:44.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:2
rsbNotes.text: 27:2 eat up my flesh. The enemy seeks the physical harm of the psalmist. The expression also has a figurative meaning, “to slander me.”

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:4
rsbNotes.text: 27:4 house of the Lord. The place where God’s presence is manifest is a place of sanctuary from the enemy.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:5
rsbNotes.text: 27:5 lift me high. Above all trouble.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 27:6
rsbNotes.text: 27:6 sacrifices with shouts of joy. He shouts for victory because the Lord has saved him.
